channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Best Mushroom Coffee, WIRED Tested and Reviewed (2025)
item.description: “Coffee” made with functional mushrooms like lion’s mane and chaga is all the rage. We tried the most popular brands to find which were the most palat...

item.title: Hypershell Pro X Series Review: An Exoskeleton You Can Actually Buy
item.description: This wearable power-up gives your legs a boost up hills, and unlike the competition, you can actually buy it, but we’re not totally sure you should.

item.title: Razer BlackShark V3 Pro Review: High-End Gaming Audio
item.description: This pro-level gaming headset is also great for casual gamers, if you’re willing to spend $250.

item.title: Users turn to chatbots for spiritual guidance
item.description: At least one website claims to allow users to chat with God.

item.title: iPhone 17, iPhone Air, AirPods Pro 3, and everything else announced at Apple’s hardware event
item.description: From a new slim iPhone Air model to redesigned AirPods, here's what was announced at this year's Apple event.

item.title: 11 Best Protein Powders, According to Years of Testing (2025)
item.description: We found the best protein powders that won’t make your shake taste like drywall.

item.title: Karen Hao on the Empire of AI, AGI evangelists, and the cost of belief
item.description: OpenAI’s rise isn’t just a business story — it’s an ideological one. On Equity, Karen Hao, author of Empire AI, explores how the cult of AGI has fuele...

item.title: How to Switch to Google Fi (2025): Plans, Tips, and Advice
item.description: Here’s everything you need to know about switching from Verizon, T-Mobile, or AT&T to the search giant’s cell service.

item.title: Vibe coding has turned senior devs into ‘AI babysitters,’ but they say it’s worth it
item.description: TechCrunch spoke to experienced coders about their time using AI-generated code about what they see as the future of vibe coding.

item.title: OpenAI board chair Bret Taylor says we’re in an AI bubble (but that’s okay)
item.description: Like OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, Bret Taylor thinks we're in an AI bubble — but he doesn't sound too worried about it.
